apps package¶

Submodules¶

apps.app module¶

apps.app.server(input: Inputs, output: Outputs, session: Session)¶

apps.functions module¶

apps.functions.get_excel_sheet_names(file_path: Path) → List[str]¶

Get a list of all sheet names for the uploaded Excel file.

Parameters:

file_path (Path) – Path to the uploaded Excel file.

Returns:

A list of all sheet names for the uploaded Excel file. Returns an empty list if the file path is invalid or there is an error reading the file.

Return type:

List[str]

apps.functions.get_file_id(input_file_format_str: str) → str¶

Generate a file_id based on the file format selected by the user.

Parameters:

input_file_format_str (str) – File format string, e.g., “.csv”, “.tsv”, “.xlsx”.

Returns:

The file_id based on the provided file format string.

Return type:

str

apps.functions.input_file(file_extension_str: str) → input_file¶

Create a file input for users to upload a file.

Parameters:

file_extension_str (str) – File extension string, e.g., “.csv”, “.tsv”, “.xlsx”.

Returns:

File input for users to upload a file, with the input id based on the provided file_extension_str.

Return type:

ui.input_file

apps.functions.quotechar_input_radio_buttons() → input_radio_buttons¶

Create a radio button group for users to select a quote character for input.

Returns:

A radio button group for selecting a quote character. Users can choose from Double Quote (”) and Single Quote (’).

Return type:

ui.input_radio_buttons

apps.functions.return_choices_for_columns(data_frame: DataFrame, plot_type: str) → List[str]¶

Return a list of column names for the dropdown based on the plot type.

Parameters:

  • data_frame (pd.DataFrame) – The input data frame.

  • plot_type (str) – The plot type selected by the user.

Returns:

A list of column names for the dropdown based on the plot type.

Return type:

List[str]

apps.functions.sep_input_radio_buttons() → input_radio_buttons¶

Create a radio button group for users to select a separator for input.

Returns:

A radio button group for selecting a separator. Users can choose from Comma (,), Semicolon (;), and Tab (` `).

Return type:

ui.input_radio_buttons

apps.functions.update_xaxis_input_select(plot_type: str, choices: List[str]) → update_select¶

Update the x-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Parameters:

  • plot_type (str) – The plot type selected by the user.

  • choices (List[str]) – A list of column names for the dropdown based on the plot type.

Returns:

An updated x-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Return type:

ui.update_select

apps.functions.update_yaxis_input_select(plot_type: str, choices: List[str])¶

Update the y-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Parameters:

  • plot_type (str) – The plot type selected by the user.

  • choices (List[str]) – A list of column names for the dropdown based on the plot type.

Returns:

An updated x-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Return type:

ui.update_select

apps.functions.xaxis_input_select(plot_type_str: str) → input_select¶

Create a dropdown for users to select the x-axis.

Parameters:

plot_type_str (str) – Plot type string, e.g., “line”, “bar”, “box”, “histogram”, “scatter”.

Returns:

An empty dropdown for users to select the x-axis, where the input id is based on the provided plot_type_str.

Return type:

ui.input_select

apps.functions.yaxis_input_select(plot_type_str: str) → input_select¶

Create a dropdown for users to select the y-axis.

Parameters:

plot_type_str (str) – Plot type string, e.g., “line”, “bar”, “box”, “histogram”, “scatter”.

Returns:

An empty dropdown for users to select the y-axis, where the input id is based on the provided plot_type_str.

Return type:

ui.input_select
